feed.title: Bitcoin Core v30.0 release candidate is available

entry.title: Bitcoin Core v30.0 release candidate is available
entry.summary:
A new release candidate for Bitcoin Core, labeled as the third iteration, is currently accessible for evaluation and testing at [this location](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-30.0/test.rc3/). This update marks a significant development within the Bitcoin Core software suite, aiming to introduce enhancements and fixes that have been rigorously tested.
In parallel, the release notes which detail the changes, improvements, and potential issues addressed in this version are in the process of being completed. These notes are crucial for users and developers alike, as they provide comprehensive insights into what has been altered or introduced in this specific release. The ongoing efforts to finalize these notes can be tracked through a dedicated [GitHub pull request](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33559), where contributors collaborate to ensure accuracy and completeness of the documentation.
This phase of releasing a candidate and actively refining its accompanying documentation highlights the project's commitment to transparency and community involvement. It serves not only as an invitation for developers to test and provide feedback but also as a testament to the meticulous approach adopted by the team towards ensuring stability, security, and performance enhancements.
